Summary Author analytic agenda for finance orgs, collaborate on next-gen search engine marketing (SEM), manage and grow finance talent, staff and compensate sales teams on quarterly and annual planning cycles & advise Google sales executives. Experience Lead Financial Analyst Google October 2014  – Present (10 months) - Architecting the technical agenda for the finance org that partners on ~a third of Google's annual revenue. 
- Dotted line management of four tiers of analysts -- mentoring them on projects, conducting career conversations, coaching them on technical and business expertise. 
- Interviewing external talent for junior, peer and senior staff-fills toward maintaining a strong bench in a constantly expanding opportunity universe. 
- Managing the sales quota compensation process end-to-end for the Americas impacting 2400 heads. Oversight of analysts who perform sophisticated forecasting and algorithm redesigns, keen partnering with engineering on automation and workflow UI, and negotiation of sales targets with all management tiers down from the Chief Business Officer. 
- Collaborating with economists, data scientists, product engineers and peer global finance orgs to craft the next generation of Google's search marketing solutions. Includes traveling globally to attend Google conferences, keeping up on the latest time series models to stay ahead of evolving user query trends and upskilling toward mastery of the search auction and its role in maximizing user and advertiser ROI. 
- Daily partnering with Google Sales VP with a $4B portfolio-- be a trusted advisor on advertiser segmention, optimal adoption of Google advertiser solutions and strategic team design toward future growth. Spearhead associated annual and quarterly planning cycles. Senior Financial Analyst Google February 2011  –  October 2014  (3 years 9 months) Work in Sales Finance across areas such as revenue modeling, search auctions, digital marketing, advertising agencies and internet product economic trajectories. 
 
- Run the quota process impacting ~50% of Google revenues by partnering with Senior Vice President to guide key decisions on targets and product levers to strategize. Oversight of other analysts in developing relevant time series and linear optimization models toward target forecasting and allocation. 
- Drive strategy by daily partnership with a Sales Vice President whose organization has ~400 heads and delivers ~10% of Google revenues. Engine incremental revenues by hands-on partnering with sales leaders and ideation of solution paths for advertisers. 
- Analyze online marketing spend in 5 industries -- Automotive, Finance (Brokerage, Retail Banking, Tax and Insurance), Healthcare, Travel and Entertainment across the US. Duties involve top down macro analysis and bottom up search auction simulations. 
- Member of global team spanning Finance, R&D and Economics to develop the next generation of Search monetization solutions -- especially centered on search funnels in cross-device settings to hone attribution measurement and evolve from conventional last-click conversion models.  
- Model headcount needs of a sales organization spanning 2 continents by employing multi-variate regression, Bayesian statistics and economic KPIs. 
- Model compensation for sales organization across a variety of functions and geographies spanning 2 continents (~1500 heads). Employ heuristic approaches to drive revenue generation behavior while preserving team dynamics and company culture. 
- Drive innovation by developing advance modeling techniques surrounding data mining, forecasting, stochastics and micro-economics. Financial Analyst Epic March 2010  –  February 2011  (1 year) - Develop Excel based revenue management systems to allow customer CIOs and CFOs to keep abreast of ROI resulting from Epic software implementation 
- Liaised with Business Intelligence product teams at Epic to employ Xcelsius, universes and Crystal solutions to develop smart data visualizations for customer executives Technical Services Engineer Epic Systems June 2003  –  March 2010  (6 years 10 months) - Developed algorithms to build on string matching techniques to identify duplicate patient profiles in large healthcare systems. 
- Led the implementation of Epic software at a hospital by channeling a team of 15 technical service engineers and 20 consultants. 
- Developed debugging techniques to solve operating system level software malfunctions while managing top management expectations.
